result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wade P. Bowling

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Wade P. Bowling in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup. Bruce Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 14 CF 41, 13 CM 359, 13 CT 46.  Court calls case 9:02 and 
State recites plea 13 CT 46 - NC to count 1 - cts 2 and 3 DRI - $1109.00 - 12 month revocation - AODA with VIP - IID - 15 days county jail
 13 CF 122 - NC to count 1 - sentence w/held probation 2 yrs - 60 days county jail with 4 days credit consecutive to 13 CT 46 - AODA and any follow thru - DNA sample and surcharge - costs
13 CM 359 - nc  battery and balance would be DRI - Sentence w/held probation 2 years - no contact with Dennis Quarderer $505.00 fine
Atty Gramstrup agrees as does the defendant.
Court questions Defendant as plea questionnaire.  Defendnat entered plea of NC to 13 CT 46, 13 CF 122 and 13 CM 359.  Court finds defendant guilty of these counts and balance of counts and cases are dismissed and read-in.  State argues sentencing.  Atty Gramstrup argues sentencing.

COURT:    Case is dismissed and read-in

Defendant Wade P. Bowling in court with attorney Chris A. Gramstrup.  Bruce Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 13 CF 122, 13 CM 359 and 13 CT 46 Atty Gramstrup waived preliminary exam.  Court advised the defendant has to his right to a preliminary exam in case 13 CF 122.  Defendant does not wish to have a preliminary exam.  Court finds defendant has freely waived his right to a preliminary exam - finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial in 13 CF 122.   Atty Gramstrup requests other cases be set for a status conference needs 60 days to complete the program and is progressing very well.   Court questions the attorney's.  Court makes further stmt.  All cases to track together - final status set for 9/30/15 after the 30th will not agree to any amendments.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Wade P. Bowling in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DEF states he wants a new attorney.  DEF to contact public defender for new counsel.  Court states these matters are old and must proceed quickly.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 09:15 am.

Defendant Wade P. Bowling in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. close to resolution request adjournment  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Not Guilty Plea, acknowledges receipt of information

Defendant Wade P. Bowling in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DEF waives rights to preliminary hearing.  other cases (13CT46, 13CF122, 13CM359) belong to Judge Anderson - Court extended time limits (20 days) for filing proper paperwork, NG plea is entered  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Wade P. Bowling in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint. Pleads Not Guilty. Waives time limits for Preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 03:30 pm.  Bond continues.

Defendant Wade P. Bowling in court, in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, wishes to contact counsel,  CBS $5000.00   Absolute Sobriety  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 10:00 am.
